subject: Climate & Environment
title: Indigenous Peoples and Forest Loss
description: A quick, practical guide to Indigenous Peoples and Forest Loss.

hook.text: About 370 million Indigenous people depend on forests for food, shelter, and identity.

buildup.text: Indigenous lands make up 22% of the world's surface but hold 80% of remaining biodiversity.

discovery.text: Studies show deforestation rates are far lower on land managed by Indigenous communities.

twist.text: Despite this, land rights are often ignored. Loggers and ranchers push people off their land.

climax.text: Securing Indigenous land rights may be the single most effective conservation strategy.

punchline.text: The best forest guardians are the ones who lived there first.

quiz.question: How much of the world's remaining biodiversity is on Indigenous lands?
